briefdescription.para: Item overrides the default layout item painting method.
Flags for controlling how an item behaves.
Layout item incremental movement, e.g. as a result of a keypress.
Margin for labels from edge of map.
Base id for plugin based item undo commands.
Layout item undo commands, used for collapsing undo commands.
True if item has a background.

detaileddescription.para: Data defined properties may mean this value differs from mExcludeFromExports.

briefdescription.para: Whether item should be excluded in exports.
True if item has a frame.
Constructor for QgsLayoutItem, with the specified parent layout.

detaileddescription.para: If manageZValue is true, the z-Value of this item will be managed by the layout. Generally this is the desired behavior.

memberdef.argsstring: (const QgsLayoutPoint &point, bool useReferencePoint=true, bool includesFrame=false, int page=-1)
memberdef.name: attemptMove

briefdescription.para: Attempts to move the item to a specified point.

detaileddescription.para: If useReferencePoint is true, this method will respect the item's reference point, in that the item will be moved so that its current reference point is placed at the specified target point.
If useReferencePoint is false, the item will be moved so that point falls at the top-left corner of the item.
If includesFrame is true, then the position specified by point represents the point at which to place the outside of the item's frame.
If page is not left at the default -1 value, then the position specified by point refers to the relative position on the corresponding layout page (where a page of 0 represents the first page).
Note that the final position of the item may not match the specified target position, as data defined item position may override the specified value.

briefdescription.para: Attempts to shift the item's position by a specified deltaX and deltaY, in layout units.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the final position of the item may not match the specified offsets, as data defined item position and size may override the specified value.

briefdescription.para: Attempts to resize the item to a specified target size.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the final size of the item may not match the specified target size, as items with a fixed or minimum size will place restrictions on the allowed item size. Data defined item size overrides will also override the specified target size.
If includesFrame is true, then the size specified by size includes the item's frame.

briefdescription.para: Attempts to update the item's position and size to match the passed rect in layout coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: If includesFrame is true, then the position and size specified by rect represents the position and size at for the outside of the item's frame.
Note that the final position and size of the item may not match the specified target rect, as data defined item position and size may override the specified value.

briefdescription.para: Returns the background color for this item.

detaileddescription.para:
This is only used if hasBackground() returns true.
setBackgroundColor()
hasBackground()

briefdescription.para: Starts new undo command for this item.

detaileddescription.para:
The commandText should be a capitalized, imperative tense description (e.g. "Add Map Item"). If specified, multiple consecutive commands for this item with the same command will be collapsed into a single undo command in the layout history.
endCommand()
cancelCommand()

briefdescription.para: Returns the item's composition blending mode.
Cancels the current item command and discards it.
Called just before a batch of items are deleted, allowing them to run cleanup tasks.
Returns true if the item contains contents with blend modes or transparency effects which can only be reproduced by rastering the item.

detaileddescription.para: Subclasses should ensure that implemented overrides of this method also check the base class result.

briefdescription.para: Creates a new layout undo command with the specified text and parent.

detaileddescription.para: The id argument can be used to specify an id number for the source event - this is used to determine whether QUndoCommand command compression can apply to the command.

briefdescription.para: This method needs to be reimplemented in all classes which implement this interface and return an expression context.

detaileddescription.para:
This is the item's id if set, and if not, a user-friendly string identifying item type.
id()
setId()

briefdescription.para: Completes the current item command and push it onto the layout's undo stack.
Returns the estimated amount the item's frame bleeds outside the item's actual rectangle.

detaileddescription.para: For instance, if the item has a 2mm frame stroke, then 1mm of this frame is drawn outside the item's rect. In this case the return value will be 1.0.
Returned values are in layout units.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether the item should be excluded from layout exports and prints.
Called after all pending items have been restored from XML.

detaileddescription.para:
Items can use this method to run steps which must take place after all items have been restored to the layout, such as connecting to signals emitted by other items, which may not have existed in the layout at the time readXml() was called. E.g. a scalebar can use this to connect to its linked map item after restoration from XML.
readXml()

briefdescription.para: Returns the fixed size of the item, if applicable, or an empty size if item can be freely resized.
Returns true if the item includes a frame.
Returns the join style used for drawing the item's frame.

detaileddescription.para:
This is only used if frameEnabled() returns true.
frameEnabled()
setFrameStrokeColor()
frameJoinStyle()
setFrameStrokeColor()

This is only used if frameEnabled() returns true.
frameEnabled()
setFrameStrokeWidth()
frameJoinStyle()
frameStrokeColor()

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the item has a background.

detaileddescription.para:
This is not necessarily unique, and duplicate ID names may exist for a layout.
setId()
uuid()

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the item is part of a QgsLayoutItemGroup group.
Returns true if the item is locked, and cannot be interacted with using the mouse.
Returns the item's flags, which indicate how the item behaves.

detaileddescription.para:
This method should be used instead of QGraphicsItem::opacity() as any data defined overrides will be respected.
opacity as double between 1.0 (opaque) and 0 (transparent).
setItemOpacity()

briefdescription.para: Returns the current rotation for the item, in degrees clockwise.

detaileddescription.para: Note that this method will always return the user-set rotation for the item, which may differ from the current item rotation (if data defined rotation settings are present). Use QGraphicsItem::rotation() to obtain the current item rotation.

briefdescription.para: Returns the minimum allowed size of the item, if applicable, or an empty size if item can be freely resized.
Moves the content of the item, by a specified dx and dy in layout units.

detaileddescription.para:
The default implementation has no effect.
setMoveContentPreviewOffset()
zoomContent()

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of layers that this item requires for exporting during layered exports (e.g.

detaileddescription.para: SVG). Returns 0 if this item is to be placed on the same layer as the previous item, 1 if it should be placed on its own layer, and >1 if it requires multiple export layers.
Items which require multiply layers should check QgsLayoutContext::currentExportLayer() during their rendering to determine which layer should be drawn.

briefdescription.para: Returns the page the item is currently on, with the first page returning 0.
Returns the item's position (in layout units) relative to the top left corner of its current page.
Returns the item's position (in item units) relative to the top left corner of its current page.
Handles preparing a paint surface for the layout item and painting the item's content.

detaileddescription.para: Derived classes must not override this method, but instead implement the pure virtual method QgsLayoutItem::draw.

briefdescription.para: Returns the item's parent group, if the item is part of a QgsLayoutItemGroup group.
Returns the item's current position, including units.

detaileddescription.para:
The position returned is the position of the item's reference point, which may not necessarily be the top left corner of the item.
attemptMove()
referencePoint()
sizeWithUnits()

briefdescription.para: Sets the item state from a DOM element.

detaileddescription.para:
itemElement
is the DOM node corresponding to item (e.g. 'LayoutItem' element)
document
DOM document
context
read write context
Note that item subclasses should not rely on all other items being present in the layout at the time this method is called. Instead, any connections and links to other items must be made in the finalizeRestoreFromXml() method. E.g. when restoring a scalebar, the connection to the linked map's signals should be implemented in finalizeRestoreFromXml(), not readXml().

briefdescription.para: Returns the item's rectangular bounds, including any bleed caused by the item's frame.

detaileddescription.para: The bounds are returned in the item's coordinate system (see Qt's QGraphicsItem docs for more details about QGraphicsItem coordinate systems). The results differ from Qt's rect() function, as rect() makes no allowances for the portion of outlines which are drawn outside of the item.

briefdescription.para: Returns the reference point for positioning of the layout item.

detaileddescription.para:
This point is also fixed during resizing of the item, and any size changes will be performed so that the position of the reference point within the layout remains unchanged.
setReferencePoint()

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the item is drawn in such a way that forces the whole layout to be rasterized when exporting to vector formats.
Sets the background color for this item.
Sets whether this item has a background drawn under it or not.
Sets the item's composition blending mode.
Sets whether the item should be excluded from layout exports and prints.
Sets whether this item has a frame drawn around it or not.
Sets the join style used when drawing the item's frame.

detaileddescription.para:
This is not necessarily unique, and duplicate ID names may exist for a layout.
id()
uuid()

This method should be used instead of QGraphicsItem::setOpacity() as any data defined overrides will be respected.
opacity
double between 1.0 (opaque) and 0 (transparent).
itemOpacity()

briefdescription.para: Sets whether the item is locked, preventing mouse interactions with the item.
Sets temporary offset for the item, by a specified dx and dy in layout units.

detaileddescription.para:
This is useful for live updates when moving item content in a QgsLayoutView. The default implementation has no effect.
moveContent()

briefdescription.para: Sets the reference point for positioning of the layout item.

detaileddescription.para:
This point is also fixed during resizing of the item, and any size changes will be performed so that the position of the reference point within the layout remains unchanged.
referencePoint()

briefdescription.para: Sets whether the item should be selected.
Sets whether the item is visible.

simplesect.para: QGraphicsItem::setVisible should not be called directly on a QgsLayoutItem, as some item types (e.g., groups) need to override the visibility toggle.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether the item should be drawn in the current context.
Returns the item's current size, including units.
Returns a unique graphics item type identifier.

detaileddescription.para: Plugin based subclasses should return an identifier greater than QgsLayoutItemRegistry::PluginItem.

This is a unique random string set for the item upon creation.
There is no corresponding setter for the uuid - it's created automatically.
id()
setId()

briefdescription.para: Stores the item state in a DOM element.

detaileddescription.para:
Does nothing by default.
factor
zoom factor, where > 1 results in a zoom in and < 1 results in a zoom out
point
item point for zoom center
moveContent()

briefdescription.para: Forces a deferred update of any cached image the item uses.
Triggers a redraw (update) of the item.
Refreshes the item, causing a recalculation of any property overrides and recalculation of its position and size.
Refreshes a data defined property for the item by reevaluating the property's value and redrawing the item with this new value.

detaileddescription.para: If property is set to QgsLayoutObject::AllProperties then all data defined properties for the item will be refreshed.

briefdescription.para: Rotates the item by a specified angle in degrees clockwise around a specified reference point.
Sets the layout item's rotation, in degrees clockwise.

detaileddescription.para: If adjustPosition is true, then this rotation occurs around the center of the item. If adjustPosition is false, rotation occurs around the item origin.

briefdescription.para: Emitted if the item's frame style changes.
Emitted if the item's lock status changes.
Emitted when the item's size or position changes.

memberdef.argsstring: (QPointF point, QSizeF size, ReferencePoint reference) const
memberdef.name: adjustPointForReferencePosition

briefdescription.para: Adjusts the specified point at which a reference position of the item sits and returns the top left corner of the item, if reference point were placed at the specified position.
Applies any present data defined size overrides to the specified layout size.
Applies any item-specific size constraint handling to a given targetSize in layout units.

detaileddescription.para:
Subclasses can override this method if they need to apply advanced logic regarding item sizes, which cannot be covered by setFixedSize() or setMinimumSize(). Item size constraints are applied after fixed, minimum and data defined size constraints.
setFixedSize()
setMinimumSize()

briefdescription.para: Draws the item's contents using the specified item render context.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the context's painter has been scaled so that painter units are pixels. Use the QgsRenderContext methods to convert from millimeters or other units to the painter's units.

briefdescription.para: Draws the background for the item.
Draws a debugging rectangle of the item's current bounds within the specified painter.
Draws the frame around the item.
Returns the current position (in layout units) of a reference point for the item.
Sets item state from a DOM element.

detaileddescription.para:
element
is the DOM element for the item
document
DOM document
context
read write context
Note that item subclasses should not rely on all other items being present in the layout at the time this method is called. Instead, any connections and links to other items must be made in the finalizeRestoreFromXml() method. E.g. when restoring a scalebar, the connection to the linked map's signals should be implemented in finalizeRestoreFromXml(), not readPropertiesFromElement().

briefdescription.para: Refresh item's background color, considering data defined colors.

detaileddescription.para: If updateItem is set to false, the item will not be automatically updated after the frame color is set and a later call to update() must be made.

briefdescription.para: Refresh item's blend mode, considering data defined blend mode.
Refresh item's frame, considering data defined colors and frame size.

detaileddescription.para: If updateItem is set to false, the item will not be automatically updated after the frame is set and a later call to update() must be made.

briefdescription.para: Refreshes an item's position by rechecking it against any possible overrides such as data defined positioning.
Refreshes an item's rotation by rechecking it against any possible overrides such as data defined rotation.

detaileddescription.para: The optional origin point specifies the origin (in item coordinates) around which the rotation should be applied.

briefdescription.para: Refreshes an item's size by rechecking it against any possible item fixed or minimum sizes.
Refresh item's opacity, considering data defined opacity.

detaileddescription.para: If updateItem is set to false the item will not be automatically updated after the opacity is set and a later call to update() must be made.

briefdescription.para: Sets a fixed size for the layout item, which prevents it from being freely resized.

detaileddescription.para:
Set an empty size if item can be freely resized.
fixedSize()
setMinimumSize()

briefdescription.para: Sets the minimum allowed size for the layout item.

detaileddescription.para:
Set an empty size if item can be freely resized.
minimumSize()
setFixedSize()

briefdescription.para: Returns the position for the reference point of the item, if the top-left of the item was placed at the specified point.
Stores item state within an XML DOM element.

parameterdescription.para: is the DOM element to store the item's properties in

briefdescription.para: Prepares a painter by setting rendering flags.
Base class for graphical items within a QgsLayout.
